Determine the length of the side of a square given the area.
24

To determine the length of the side of a square given its area, you can use the formula for the area of a square:

\[ \text{Area} = \text{side}^2 \]

Given that the area is 24, you set up the equation:

\[ \text{side}^2 = 24 \]

To find the length of the side, take the square root of both sides:

\[ \text{side} = \sqrt{24} \]

Simplifying \(\sqrt{24}\), you get:

\[ \sqrt{24} = \sqrt{4 \times 6} = \sqrt{4} \times \sqrt{6} = 2\sqrt{6} \]

So, the length of the side of the square is \(2\sqrt{6}\) units.
